discussion.content:
B & D is Correct.
To close your opportunity as won, select Close as Won.
In Actual Revenue, Verify the amount, and make changes, if necessary.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales-enterprise/close-opportunity-won-lost-sales

B and D seem to be correct options...
While closing an opportunity, we set the status reason and actual revenue

comments.content: Yes, because on the small popup pane B, D is required, and there is also a description field.

discussion.content: If you actually close an opportunity as won the pop-up gives you 3 required bits of information. Status reason is required and it is automatically marked as Won, if you click on the drop down you can not change that option. That leaves the actual revenue, which you can update on that dialog box and the date which you can update on that dialog box. Therefore the only items you have control of are the Date and the Actual Revenue.

comments.content: Okay after taking a second look at this question, I believe the Correct answer should be B and D. I'll tell you why. B because you have to set the status reason as won and D because you have to set the Actual revenue which is the actual amount you made from the opportunity (just twist of English). Option A is wrong because you can't actually change Est Revenue to Actual Revenue in the opportunity close form. Option C also wrong because you can't change Est Close date to actual close date on the oppt close form. I don't know if i'm making sense but....

discussion.content: C is eliminated because logically, Estimated Close Date may not be Actual Close Date.
A,B - A should say Est Revenue to 'Actual REVENUE' (as its the Act Rev field that is shown on Opp Close)

comments.content: Sorry , it is B and D

discussion.content: Should be A and C
Does not make sense.

choices.A: Change Est. Revenue to Actual amount
choices.C: Change Est. Close Date to Actual close date.
choices.D: Change the Actual Revenue to Actual amount.
choices.B: Set the Status reason to Won.

discussion.content:
On exam 27/4/22. Passed. I selected
Display In
Lists for related record types

1,1 
Display In
Lists for related record types

1-a , 2-a is correct.
I just tried by myself. 
Question mentions that Advance find query was run on Account table so Related record type will be account which is also selected in screenshot of question. 

Now to make this report available in Advance find query of Account table, You have to set Display in property to "Lists for related record types".

 I tried adding and removing this property and it was showing and hiding from advance find. You have run report option when you get query result, Under Data (from same option where you can export excel).

"Display In" and "Lists for Related record types" 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/user/create-report-with-wizard lists out steps to create a report. 
"Display In" provides values to display the created report in "Reports area" or "through ribbon buttons of Form related to that entity" or "through Ribbon button of home page grid related to that entity". 
"lists of related record types" is for list which internally works for advanced find results as well.
1c-2c corretti
1c-2c correct
1a-2a correct

Checkt it _ Area => Display In and the Value => List for related record types
so it is 1 and 1
after that - this is not part of the question - you must set in the area Relateted Record Types a value like Account, Activty etc.
In exam, Jun-22 (similar question, not exactly the same)

Display In
Reports Area
